statement.tex: \text{The radius of a circle is increasing }\\ \text{uniformly at the rate of 3 cm/s.} \\ \text{Find the rate at which the area is}\\ \text{increasing when the radius is 10 cm.}

step.context: \textbf{Right or wrong? }\text{ - Is the following}\\ \text{what we know and what we have to find?}
step.tex: \begin{tabular}{c|c} \text{We know} & \text{We have to find} \\ \hline \frac{dR}{dT}=\text{3 cm/s} & \left[\frac{dA}{dT}\right]_{R=10} \\ \hline \end{tabular}\\ \text{where A = circle's area and R = it's radius.}

\begin{tabular}{c|c} \text{We know} & \text{We have to find} \\ \hline \frac{dA}{dT}=\text{3 cm}^2/s & \left[\frac{dA}{dR}\right]_{R=10} \\ \hline \end{tabular}\\ \text{where A = circle's area and R = it's radius.}
step.reason: \text{The 3 cm/s is } = \frac{dR}{dT}. \\ \text{What we need to find is }\frac{dA}{dT}.
